Posts.Content: It's not silly at all. The thing is you can never really know. So why walk around feeling worried all the time and trying to guess if it's back or not? I wouldn't stop going to the doctor, maybe just go less often.
Posts.Title: worry or not to worry

Posts.Content: My wife was diagnosed. I survived hodgkins diseases but i'm guessing it's different. Any tips?
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hmm... Maybe a little bit over reacting. Because who cares if she's taking you seriously or not? As long as she's going to get tested the rest just donesn't matter. I think it's even better that she isn't taking you seriously. Would you prefer it if she was scared and woried right now? What for? Just make sure she takes the test. That's it.
Posts.Title: Cancer smell

Posts.Content: no, they see you anyway after the test, they are the ones who understand the results and explain them to you. Even if it's good. At least here it's like this.
Posts.Title: Should I be worried?
